DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Biological therapy use different way stimulate immune system stop cancer cell grow . Combining chemotherapy peripheral stem cell transplantation biological therapy may kill cancer cell . PURPOSE : Phase II trial study effectiveness biological therapy sargramostim , interleukin-2 , interferon alfa follow chemotherapy peripheral stem cell transplantation treat patient cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Biological Therapy Following Chemotherapy Peripheral Stem Cell Transplantation Treating Patients With Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine feasibility therapy sargramostim ( GM-CSF ) , interleukin-2 interferon alfa follow high dose chemotherapy autologous stem cell rescue patient high risk cancer . - Determine effect regimen long-term leukocyte platelet recovery follow high dose chemotherapy stem cell rescue patient . - Determine cellular response regimen patient . - Assess progression free overall survival rate patient . OUTLINE : This dose escalation study interleukin-2 interferon alfa . Beginning 14 day autologous stem cell transplant , patient receive daily subcutaneous injection sargramostim ( GM-CSF ) day 1-7 daily intravenous interleukin-2 day 3-7 , follow 1 week rest . Patients receive subcutaneous injection interferon alfa three time week 3 week follow one week rest . Treatment repeat four course . Cohorts 10 patient receive escalate dos interleukin-2 interferon alfa maximum tolerate dose ( MTD ) determine . The MTD define dose 3 10 patient experience dose limit toxicity . Intrapatient dose escalation occur course 2-4 , absence dose limit toxicity . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A maximum 40 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosis one follow cancer undergo high dose chemotherapy autologous stem cell rescue ( ASCR ) : Metastatic breast cancer Multiple myeloma Hodgkin 's disease Recurrent refractory low , intermediate , high grade nonHodgkin 's lymphoma Acute myelogenous leukemia beyond first remission Acute lymphoblastic leukemia beyond first remission Ovarian cancer Refractory malignancy measurable evaluable disease ( time ASCR ) Hormone receptor status : Not specify A new classification scheme adult nonHodgkin 's lymphoma adopt PDQ . The terminology `` indolent '' `` aggressive '' lymphoma replace former terminology `` low '' , `` intermediate '' , `` high '' grade lymphoma . However , protocol us former terminology . PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : Not specify Menopausal status : Not specify Performance status : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : See Disease Characteristics Chemotherapy : See Disease Characteristics Endocrine therapy : Not specify Radiotherapy : Not specify Surgery : Not specify
